title: Computer-Assisted Mathematics Language Learning Design Using Web 2.0 Technologies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Terminology and Elementary Education Curriculum
context.additional_context: For graduate students and job seekers, utilizing mobile devices in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment

learning_goals: Create elementary mathematics vocabulary explanation content using Web 2.0 tools (blogs, wikis, collaborative platforms).
Develop feedback-based problem-solving strategies with peer learners using real-time collaboration tools.
Improve self-directed mathematical language learning abilities by documenting the learning process in a digital portfolio.
Cultivate the ability to connect mathematical concepts with visual language through the use of data visualization tools.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
